solution_line_template: Jackson spent a total of {vacuuming_hours_per_session} * {vacuuming_sessions} = <<{vacuuming_hours_per_session}*{vacuuming_sessions}={total_vacuuming_hours}>>{total_vacuuming_hours} hours vacuuming.
This means he earned {total_vacuuming_hours} * ${money_per_hour} = <<{total_vacuuming_hours}*{money_per_hour}={earnings_from_vacuuming}>>{earnings_from_vacuuming} dollars from vacuuming.
He earned {dish_washing_hours} * ${money_per_hour} = <<{dish_washing_hours}*{money_per_hour}={earnings_from_dishes}>>{earnings_from_dishes} dollars from washing dishes.

Cleaning the bathroom took three times as long as the dishes, so he spent {dish_washing_hours} * {bathroom_time_multiplier} = <<{dish_washing_hours}*{bathroom_time_multiplier}={bathroom_cleaning_hours}>>{bathroom_cleaning_hours} hours in the bathroom.
This means he earned {bathroom_cleaning_hours} * ${money_per_hour} = $<<{bathroom_cleaning_hours}*{money_per_hour}={earnings_from_bathroom}>>{earnings_from_bathroom} from cleaning the bathroom.
